intro: Blepharis frutescens, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine, hairy hairs, and its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple in color. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Blepharis frutescens is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
